intro: Titanopsis primosii, commonly known as the naked lady cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are often covered in sparse, white hairs. The plant produces striking, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It is a low-maintenance cactus that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for desert gardens and rockeries.
